title: Foundation_types IM definitions
$comments: Part of BASE component, Release-1.2.0 version.

Hash.title: Hash
Hash.description: Type representing a keyed table of values. V is the value type, and K the type of the keys.
Hash.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Container

Hash<String, Hash<String, Hash<String, S.title: Hash<String, Hash<String, Hash<String, String>>>
Hash<String, Hash<String, Hash<String, S.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Hash

Hash<String, Hash<String, String>>.title: Hash<String, Hash<String, String>>
Hash<String, Hash<String, String>>.description: Two-level hash map structure, typically used for two levels of keyed tables, e.g. with outer keys = language ("en", "zh" etc) and inner keys = some tag or id or path.
Hash<String, Hash<String, String>>.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Hash

Hash<String, String>.title: Hash<String, String>
Hash<String, String>.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Hash

Container.title: Container
Container.description: Abstract ancestor of container types whose items are addressable in some way.

List.title: List
List.description: Ordered container that may contain duplicates.
List.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Container

Set.title: Set
Set.description: Unordered container that may not contain duplicates.
Set.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Container

Array.title: Array
Array.description: Container whose storage is assumed to be contiguous.
Array.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Container

Set<String>.title: Set<String>
Set<String>.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Set

List<String>.title: List<String>
List<String>.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from List

Hash<String, List<String>>.title: Hash<String, List<String>>
Hash<String, List<String>>.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Hash

Container<Numeric>.title: Container<Numeric>
Container<Numeric>.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Container

Uri.title: Uri
Uri.description: A kind of String constrained to obey the syntax of RFC 3986.
Uri.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from String

Ordered_Numeric.title: Ordered_Numeric
Ordered_Numeric.description: Abstract notional parent class of ordered, numeric types, which are types with both the `_less_than_()` and arithmetic functions defined.
Ordered_Numeric.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, abstract, inherits from Ordered, Numeric

Integer.title: Integer
Integer.description: Type representing minimal interface of built-in Integer type.
Integer.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Ordered_Numeric

Double.title: Double
Double.description: Type used to represent double-precision decimal numbers. Corresponds to a double-precision floating point value in most languages.
Double.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Ordered_Numeric

Numeric.title: Numeric
Numeric.description: Abstract parent class of numeric types, which are types which have various arithmetic and comparison operators defined.

Octet.title: Octet
Octet.description: Type representing minimal interface of built-in Octet type.
Octet.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Ordered

Character.title: Character
Character.description: Type representing minimal interface of built-in Character type.
Character.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Ordered

Boolean.title: Boolean
Boolean.description: Type representing minimal interface of built-in Boolean type.

String.title: String
String.description: Type representing minimal interface of built-in String type, as used to represent textual data in any natural or formal language.
String.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Ordered

Real.title: Real
Real.description: Type used to represent decimal numbers. Corresponds to a single-precision floating point value in most languages.
Real.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Ordered_Numeric

Integer64.title: Integer64
Integer64.description: Type representing minimal interface of built-in Integer64 type.
Integer64.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Ordered_Numeric

Ordered.title: Ordered
Ordered.description: Abstract parent class of ordered types i.e. types on which the '<' operator is defined.

Any.title: Any
Any.description: Abstract ancestor class for all other classes. Usually maps to a type like `Any` or `Object` in an object-oriented technology. Defined here to provide value and reference equality semantics.

Iso8601_date_time.title: Iso8601_date_time
Iso8601_date_time.description:
Represents an ISO 8601 date/time, including partial and extended forms. Value may be:

* `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[(,|.)sss][Z | ±hh[:mm]]` (extended, preferred) or
* `YYYYMMDDThhmmss[(,|.)sss][Z | ±hh[mm]]` (compact)
* or a partial variant.

See `_valid_iso8601_date_time()_` for validity.

Note that this class includes 2 deviations from ISO 8601:2004:

* for partial date/times, any part of the date/time up to the month may be missing, not just seconds and minutes as in the standard;
* the time `24:00:00` is not allowed, since it would mean the date was really on the next day.
Iso8601_date_time.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Iso8601_type

value.description: Representation of all descendants is a single String.

Iso8601_duration.title: Iso8601_duration
Iso8601_duration.description:
Represents an ISO 8601 duration, which may have multiple parts from years down to seconds. The `_value_` attribute is a String in the format:

* `P[nnY][nnM][nnW][nnD][T[nnH][nnM][nnS]]`

NOTE: two deviations from ISO 8601 are supported, the first, to allow a negative sign, and the second allowing the 'W' designator to be mixed with other designators.
Iso8601_duration.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Iso8601_type

value.description: Representation of all descendants is a single String.

Iso8601_time.title: Iso8601_time
Iso8601_time.description:
Represents an ISO 8601 time, including partial and extended forms. Value may be:

* `hh:mm:ss[(,|.)sss][Z|±hh[:mm]]` (extended, preferred) or
* `hhmmss[(,|.)sss][Z|±hh[mm]]` (compact)
* or a partial invariant.

See `_valid_iso8601_time()_` for validity.

NOTE: A small deviation to the ISO 8601:2004 standard in this class is that the time `24:00:00` is not allowed, for consistency with `Iso8601_date_time`.
Iso8601_time.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Iso8601_type

value.description: Representation of all descendants is a single String.

Iso8601_timezone.title: Iso8601_timezone
Iso8601_timezone.description:
ISO8601 timezone string, in format:

* `Z | ±hh[mm]`

where:

* `hh` is "00" - "23" (0-filled to two digits)
* `mm` is "00" - "59" (0-filled to two digits)
* `Z` is a literal meaning UTC (modern replacement for GMT), i.e. timezone `+0000`
Iso8601_timezone.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Iso8601_type

value.description: Representation of all descendants is a single String.

Iso8601_type.title: Iso8601_type
Iso8601_type.description: Abstract ancestor type of ISO 8601 types, defining interface for 'extended' and 'partial' concepts from ISO 8601.
Iso8601_type.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, abstract, inherits from Temporal, Time_Definitions

value.description: Representation of all descendants is a single String.

Iso8601_date.title: Iso8601_date
Iso8601_date.description:
Represents an ISO 8601 date, including partial and extended forms. Value may be:

* `YYYY-MM-DD` (extended, preferred)
* `YYYYMMDD` (compact)
* a partial invariant.

See `Time_definitions._valid_iso8601_date()_` for validity.
Iso8601_date.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Iso8601_type

value.description: Representation of all descendants is a single String.

Interval<Iso8601_date>.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Interval

lower_included.description: `lower` boundary value included in range if not `lower_unbounded`.

upper_included.description: `upper` boundary value included in range if not `upper_unbounded`.

Interval<Iso8601_duration>.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Interval

Time_Definitions.title: Time_Definitions
Time_Definitions.description: Definitions for date/time classes. Note that the timezone limits are set by where the international dateline is. Thus, time in New Zealand is quoted using `+12:00`, not `-12:00`.

Temporal.title: Temporal
Temporal.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, abstract, inherits from Ordered

Multiplicity_interval.title: Multiplicity_interval
Multiplicity_interval.description: An Interval of Integer, used to represent multiplicity, cardinality and optionality in models.
Multiplicity_interval.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Proper_interval

lower_included.description: `lower` boundary value included in range if not `lower_unbounded`.

upper_included.description: `upper` boundary value included in range if not `upper_unbounded`.

Proper_interval.title: Proper_interval
Proper_interval.description: Type representing a 'proper' Interval, i.e. any two-sided or one-sided interval.
Proper_interval.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Interval

lower_included.description: `lower` boundary value included in range if not `lower_unbounded`.

upper_included.description: `upper` boundary value included in range if not `upper_unbounded`.

Interval.title: Interval
Interval.description: Interval abstraction, featuring upper and lower limits that may be open or closed, included or not included.

lower_included.description: `lower` boundary value included in range if not `lower_unbounded`.

upper_included.description: `upper` boundary value included in range if not `upper_unbounded`.

Point_interval.title: Point_interval
Point_interval.description: Type representing an Interval that happens to be a point value. Provides an efficient representation that is substitutable for `Interval<T>` where needed.
Point_interval.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Interval

lower_included.description: Lower boundary value included in range if not `_lower_unbounded_`.

upper_included.description: Upper boundary value included in range if not `_upper_unbounded_`.

Cardinality.title: Cardinality
Cardinality.description: Express constraints on the cardinality of container objects which are the values of multiply-valued attributes, including uniqueness and ordering, providing the means to state that a container acts like a logical list, set or bag.

is_ordered.description: True if the members of the container attribute to which this cardinality refers are ordered.

is_unique.description: True if the members of the container attribute to which this cardinality refers are unique.

Interval<Real>.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Interval

lower_included.description: `lower` boundary value included in range if not `lower_unbounded`.

upper_included.description: `upper` boundary value included in range if not `upper_unbounded`.

Interval<Integer>.$comments: Defined in Foundation_types IM, inherits from Interval

lower_included.description: `lower` boundary value included in range if not `lower_unbounded`.

upper_included.description: `upper` boundary value included in range if not `upper_unbounded`.

Terminology_code.title: Terminology_code
Terminology_code.description: Primitive type representing a standalone reference to a terminology concept, in the form of a terminology identifier, optional version, and a code or code string from the terminology.

terminology_id.description: The archetype environment namespace identifier used to identify a terminology. Typically a value like `"snomed_ct"` that is mapped elsewhere to the full URI identifying the terminology.

terminology_version.description: Optional string value representing terminology version, typically a date or dotted numeric.

code_string.description: A terminology code or post-coordinated code expression, if supported by the terminology. The code may refer to a single term, a value set consisting of multiple terms, or some other entity representable within the terminology.

uri.description: The URI reference that may be used as a concrete key into a notional terminology service for queries that can obtain the term text, definition, and other associated elements.

Terminology_term.title: Terminology_term
Terminology_term.description: Leaf type representing a standalone term from a terminology, which consists of the term text and the code, i.e. a concept reference.

concept.description: Reference to the terminology concept formally representing this term.
